title: Business & Finance
text:
Fed officials are planning to wind down a bond-buying program sooner than a goal set just weeks ago, a shift that opens the door for the central bank to raise rates in the spring rather than later in the year to curb inflation.

---

Intel is planning to publicly list shares in its Mobileye self-driving-car unit, the latest move by CEO Gelsinger to revive the semiconductor giant's fortunes.

---

Samsung Electronics replaced the heads of its three major business units and merged the company's mobile and consumer electronics businesses into a single unit.

---

China's central bank said it would reduce the amount of money banks are required to set aside, as it moved to stimulate a slowing economy.

---

Evergrande's stock and bonds plunged after Chinese authorities stepped up their involvement in the developer's affairs and the company moved closer to reorganizing its hefty international debt.

---

The SEC is investigating Trump's social-media SPAC deal with blank-check company Digital World, according to a securities filing.

---

The SEC has opened an investigation into Tesla that touches at least in part on the company's solar-cell activity.
